intro: Cnidiocarpa rhodopetala, commonly known as the red-flowered desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom during the warmer months. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is adapted to survive in dry, nutrient-poor soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for drought-tolerant landscaping in suitable climates.
